00040 #ifndef _physactorrigid_h
00041 #define _physactorrigid_h
00042 
00043 #include "actorbase.h"
00044 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00045 
00046 ///////////////////////////////////
00047 // Forward Declares
00048 class btRigidBody;
00049 
00050 ///////////////////////////////////
00051 // Actual code
00052 namespace phys
00053 {
00054     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00055     /// @class ActorRigid
00056     /// @headerfile actorbase.h
00057     /// @brief This is the actor class for Rigid Objects.
00058     /// @details This class should be used to make any rigid object that can be moved as a
00059     /// result of force.  Most objects will fall into this catagory.  A few examples of a
00060     /// Rigid Object: Boxes, Car Frames, Chairs, etc.  For Semi Rigid bodies that are
00061     /// deformable, like jello, it is better to use ActorSoft.
00062     ///////////////////////////////////////
00063     class PHYS_LIB ActorRigid : public ActorBase {
00064         protected:
00065             friend class TypedConstraint;
00066             /// @brief Used to simulate the behavior of a btRigidBody
00067             btRigidBody* physrigidbody;
00068 
00069             /// @brief Creates a rigid object for the actor.
00070             /// @details Creates a rigid object to be placed in the physics world later. @n
00071             /// This is automaticly called by the Constructor and shouldn't be called manually.
00072             /// @param pmass "Real Mass" The mass of the object.
00073             void CreateRigidObject (Real pmass);
00074 
00075             /// @brief This creates an estimation of the shape of a body using a number of simpler primitives
00076             /// @param depth How many times should we subdivide. Larger means more parts, each one smaller, more CPU time.
00077             /// @param cpercent How concave the resulting shapes will be, lower means more accurate with more pieces.
00078             /// @param ppercent Undocumented -  set to similar number to cpercent
00079             void PerformConvexDecomposition(unsigned int depth, float cpercent, float ppercent);
00080 
00081         public:
00082             /// @brief Descriptive constructor.
00083             /// @details This constructor contains the basic information needed to make a Rigid Object. @n
00084             /// This class inherits from ActorBase.
00085             /// @param mass The mass the object will have in the World.
00086             /// @param name The name of the actor.
00087             /// @param file The 3d mesh file that contains the 3d model the actor will use.
00088             /// @param group The resource group where the 3d mesh and other related files can be found.
00089             ActorRigid(Real mass, String name, String file, String group);
00090 
00091             /// @brief Destructor.
00092             /// @details The class destructor.
00093             virtual ~ActorRigid();
00094 
00095             /// @brief Creates a collision shape from mesh file.
00096             /// @details This function will read the location of every verticy in the mesh file and use that to
00097             /// construct a triangle mesh shape and attach it to this objects collision shape.  This shoiuld
00098             /// be used with only with Dynamic objects.
00099             /// @param accuracy A value from 1 to 4. The higher the more accurate, but the more resource intensive
00100             void CreateShapeFromMeshDynamic(short unsigned int accuracy=1);
00101 
00102             /// @brief Creates a sphere collision shape.
00103             /// @details Will dynamically create a sphere collision shape from the loaded mesh file.
00104             void CreateSphereShapeFromMesh();
00105 
00106             /// @brief Creates a collision shape from mesh file.
00107             /// @details This function will read the location of every verticy in the mesh file and use that to
00108             /// construct a triangle mesh shape and attach it to this objects collision shape.  This shoiuld
00109             /// be used with only with Static objects.
00110             void CreateShapeFromMeshStatic();
00111 
00112             /// @brief Sets the Damping for this object.
00113             /// @details Both of Linear Damping and Angular Damping default to zero.  This is usful if you wish to simulate
00114             /// something like air resistance.  Values can range from 0.0 to 1.0.
00115             /// @param LinDamping Real representing the amount of Linear Damping to be applied.
00116             /// @param AngDamping Real representing the amount of Angular Damping to be applied.
00117             void SetDamping(Real LinDamping, Real AngDamping);
00118 
00119             /// @brief Sets the Linear Velocity of this object.
00120             /// @param LinVel Vector3 representing the Linear Velocity to be set.
00121             void SetLinearVelocity(Vector3 LinVel);
00122 
00123             /// @brief Gets the Linear Velocity of this object.
00124             /// @return Returns the currently set Linear Velocity of this object.
00125             Vector3 GetLinearVelocity();
00126 
00127             /// @brief Sets the Angular Velocity of this object.
00128             /// @param AngVel Vector3 representing the Angular Velocity to be set.
00129             void SetAngularVelocity(Vector3 AngVel);
00130 
00131             /// @brief Gets the Angular Velocity of this object.
00132             /// @return Returns the currently set Angular Velocity of this object.
00133             Vector3 GetAngularVelocity();
00134 
00135             /// @brief Retrieves the name of the object.
00136             /// @details This function will retrieve the name of the object,
00137             std::string GetName() const;
00138 
00139             /// @brief Restricts movement on the axis or axies of your choice.
00140             /// @details This function will lock any and all axies you define you want to be locked.
00141             /// Simply pass true to allow movement on that axis, false if you don't.  This function
00142             /// is primarily useful for 2D games, in which if you are viewing the playing area from
00143             /// the side you can pass in LimitMovementOnAxis(true,true,false) and the object will
00144             /// only be able to move up, down, or side to side, but not in or out.
00145             /// @param x Allow or Disallow use of the X axis for movement.
00146             /// @param y Allow or Disallow use of the Y axis for movement.
00147             /// @param z Allow or Disallow use of the Z axis for movement.
00148             void LimitMovementOnAxis(bool x, bool y, bool z);
00149 
00150             /// @brief Disables the deactivation of the physics body.
00151             /// @details This function is useful when using constraints to prevent it from locking in situations where it shouldn't.
00152             void DisableDeactivation();
00153 
00154             /// @brief Restores the activation state of the physics body to normal.
00155             /// @details This function is useful when you are done applying a constraint to a body, or any other effect that would have you call DisableDeactivation().
00156             void RestoreActivation();
00157 
00158             // Inherited from ActorBase
00159             virtual void AddObjectToWorld (World *TargetWorld);
00160             virtual void RemoveObjectFromWorld(World* TargetWorld);
00161     };
00162 }
00163 #endif
